title: OU shakes up SEC, CFP with upset of No. 4 Tide
content: Oklahoma sent shock waves through the SEC and revived its CFP hopes Saturday, forcing three Alabama turnovers and getting a key stop late in a 23-21 upset in Tuscaloosa.

title: Georgia gets 'down and dirty,' KO's Texas in 4th
content: The No. 5 Bulldogs once again bullied the Longhorns, delivering the knockout blow by outscoring Texas 21-0 in the fourth quarter to win 35-10 on Saturday night.

title: Kiffin on Gators rumors after win: 'I love' Ole Miss
content: Amid rumors Lane Kiffin is the top candidate for the Gators' open head coaching job, the Ole Miss coach said he "loves" being with the Rebels after their comeback win.

title: Makhachev dominates to become 2-weight champ
content: Islam Makhachev solidified himself as the UFC's pound-for-pound king, sweeping the scorecards against an overmatched Jack Della Maddalena to win the welterweight title at UFC 322.

title: Shevchenko retains crown with shutout of Zhang
content: Valentina Shevchenko had little trouble defending her flyweight title against Zhang Weili on Saturday night, winning every round on all three scorecards to retain her crown at UFC 322.

title: S. Carolina claims 1st 'Real SC' title in win vs. USC
content: South Carolina claimed the inaugural title of "The Real SC" by beating USC in a game the Gamecocks hope they can build upon.

title: No. 3 A&M makes history with 27-point comeback
content: No. 3 Texas A&M rallied from a 27-point deficit to remain undefeated with a 31-30 victory over South Carolina on Saturday.

title: B's McAvoy hit in mouth by puck vs. Canadiens
content: Boston defenseman Charlie McAvoy was hit in the mouth by a slap shot, and he left the Bruins' game at the Montreal Canadiens midway through the second period Saturday night and didn't return.

title: Fireworks for Massachusetts, down 42, top college football superlatives
content: The Minutemen's fourth-quarter field goal to cut into Northern Illinois' blowout lead produced an unfortunately viral fireworks display in Week 12.

title: USMNT player ratings: Reyna impresses with 9/10 in return vs. Paraguay
content: Gio Reyna stole the headlines with an impressive performance to lead the United States to a 2-1 win over Paraguay.

title: Perseverance leads Washington to another NWSL Championship final
content: Washington's experience from last year's NWSL Championship heartbreak is paying off as the Spirit brushed aside Portland to reach back-to-back finals.

title: Ready for NFL Week 11? We have sleepers, QB questions, trends to watch and more
content: Big game coming for Aaron Rodgers? Matchup questions for the Seahawks and Rams? An edge for Jared Goff against the Eagles? Catch up on Week 11.

title: Lucky or unlucky: How have Premier League teams fared this season?
content: Which Premier League teams have ridden their luck, and which have been unlucky over injuries, VAR and managerial changes this season?

title: Man City's big derby win over Man United shows they're the real deal in title race
content: Man City ended their derby against Man United as a contest by half-time. They have a real chance of ending Chelsea six-year WSL dominance this season.

title: NFL Week 11 odds: Chiefs road favorites at Broncos, Seahawks slight 'dogs at Rams
content: Week 11 features several big matchups. Here are the odds, spreads and totals for every NFL game this weekend.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United want to sign Wolves' João Gomes
content: Wolverhampton Wanderers midfielder João Gomes is a target for Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: CPI to stage nationwide protest on November 18 against rising atrocities
content: CPI Kalaburagi district unit will stage a demonstration in front of the Deputy Commissioner’s office on Tuesday (November 18, 2025), says CPI district secretary Dr. Mahesh Kumar Rathod

title: Rohini Acharya again hit out at Tejaswi’s close aides alleging they made her an orphan
content: In an emotional message on social media platform ‘X’, Ms. Acharya said that she did not compromise on her self-respect, neither surrender before the truth, and solely because of hate, she had to endure the insult

title: Last date for paddy crop insurance registration extended to November 30: Minister
content: Farmers had highlighted heavy rains affecting cultivation, and that officials were involved in work relating to the Special Intensive Revision of the electoral rolls.

title: Police fire at two murder accused in Karnataka’s Hubballi
content: Both the accused persons and some police officers injured in the incident were admitted to the hospital

title: 7-year-old boy dies after getting trapped inside parked car near Madurai
content: Police suspect that the boy, who could have got into the parked car, did not know how to open the door and got trapped inside

title: Six killed, 14 injured as vehicle carrying pilgrims collides with trailer in Jodhpur
content: The tempo, carrying around 20 pilgrims from Gujarat's Banaskantha and Dhansura areas and heading to Ramdeora, was hit by the speeding trailer coming from the opposite direction, says Balesar SHO Moolsingh Bhati

title: India shaping development pathways with economically sound and climate-responsible approach: UNDP chief
content: Haoliang Xu said India’s commitment to climate adaptation, renewable energy and inclusive digital finance offers a blueprint for balancing growth with sustainability

title: Suspicious bag causes scare in Nashik; cops find nothing alarming
content: The police received a call that a suspicious object was lying near the Indiranagar underpass, adjacent to the Mumbai-Agra national highway, in the morning, an official said

title: Gauhati High Court seeks reply from Assam govt. on teen’s death in makeshift shelter
content: Aynal Haque, 19, died more than a month after his family was evicted during a drive to clear government land in western Assam’s Goalpara district in June

title: State Election Commission publishes final list, Kerala has a little over 2.86 crore voters
content: The number shows an increase of 2,15,950 from the electoral rolls published on October 25, which was taken as the draft list for a two-day enrollment held on November 4 and November 5

title: Amid students' protests, Panjab University postpones exams
content: University's decision came after protesting students announced that they would boycott exams until the schedule for the Senate polls, which have not been held in over a year

title: Jaishankar discusses bilateral partnership, regional developments with Bahraini FM over call
content: They also agreed to develop a common understanding to commence negotiations for a double taxation avoidance agreement (DTAA)

title: Bihar Assembly polls: ₹14,000 from World Bank was diverted for elections, says Jan Suraaj leader
content: The amount of ₹10,000 given to women in the State was given from ₹21,000 crores, which came from the World Bank for some other project. An hour before the moral code of conduct for the polls, ₹14,000 crores were taken out and distributed to 1.25 crore women in the State, says Jan Suraaj Spokesperson Pavan Kumar

title: India's spend on Russian oil buy at €2.5 billion in October ahead of new sanctions
content: India's spending in October was unchanged from the €2.5 billion spent on buying Russian oil in September

title: Three Maoists killed in encounter with police in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
content: “The gunfight broke out in forested hills of Bhejji and Chintagufa police station areas in morning when team of DRG was out on anti-Maoist operation based on inputs about presence of Maoist cadres in region,” the SP said

title: Destruction of illegal poppy fields intensified in Manipur
content: The security forces have destroyed plants, huts, and equipment on 476 acres in five days of operation in Kangpokpi and Ukhrul districts

title: Kerala local body polls: The rise and fall of a people’s collective in Chellanam
content: In 2020, eight Independents who contested under the banner of Chellanam Twenty20 on the plank of corruption-free governance emerged victorious, making them the second-largest bloc in the 21-member hung panchayat. By the end of the term, two of its members defected to LDF and the collective disintegrated, merging with Twenty20 of Kizhakkambalam

title: Kerala local body polls: UDF, NDA hopeful of dethroning LDF in Anthoor
content: The Left front is ruling the municipality since its formation in 2015. Opponents say their activities are being stymied by the ruling coalition. CPI(M) highlights the development projects and the region’s deep ties with communism

title: Kerala local body polls: No name on voters’ list makes UDF’s  youngest candidate ineligible to contest in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: An error in providing the address has resulted in the removal of her name from the electoral roll, leading to removal from voters’ list

title: Battle for Kerala’s local bodies begins
content: While LDF is looking for a repeat of 2020, when it dominated all levels of local body tiers,  UDF and NDA are looking to change the tide, eyeing upset victories, especially in crucial Corporations and municipalities

title: West Bengal: Abhishek to launch healthcare outreach initiative ‘Sebaashray 2’ from Dec 1
content: The Trinamool general secretary had in January 2025, launched the ‘Sebaashray’ an initiative under which hundreds of free medical camps were set up across his Lok Sabha constituency Diamond Harbour

title: Direct engagement ensures market linkages for rural producers in Rajasthan
content: Several leading companies signed letters of intent (LoIs) at an event in Udaipur over the weekend, expressing readiness for large-scale procurement from SHG enterprises

title: Delhi HC steps in to revive Centre’s rare-disease crowdfunding portal after lukewarm response from sponsors
content: The initiative was launched with the hope that India’s corporate sector, philanthropists, and compassionate individuals would step in to fill a life-saving gap

title: Venezuela keen to increase cooperation in critical minerals sector with India
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal emphasised the need to reactivate the India-Venezuela Joint Committee Mechanism

title: P. Chidambaram launches book on Indian community in  Singapore
content: At the launch held here, the first copy was received by Edgar Pang, Consul General of the Republic of Singapore in Chennai.

title: Hindustan Zinc gets licence to explore, mine tungsten block in Andhra Pradesh
content: Earlier this year, Hindustan Zinc Ltd was declared the preferred bidder through a competitive auction process conducted by the Centre

title: ‘Visit Raj Bhavan and verify’, says West Bengal Governor after TMC MP alleges arms distributed from Raj Bhavan
content: The Raj Bhawan also added if the allegations are found to be untrue then the MP Kalyan Banerjee “has the decent option to apologise to the people of Bengal and face prosecution for hate speech”

title: Our voters went with NDA out of fear that RJD will bring back jungle raj: Jan Suraaj
content: Jan Suraaj Party’s national president Uday Singh also claimed “polarisation” took place in the Seemanchal region in the aftermath of the blast near Red Fort in Delhi, a day before polling was held in the area

title: West Bengal SIR: BLOs seek deadline extension, assistance with data entry; cite ‘unmanageable workload’
content: West Bengal CEO Manoj Kumar Agarwal, along with 26 District Electoral Officers and Senior Deputy Election Commissioner Gyanesh Bharti, reviewed the progress of SIR in West Bengal

title: Turning threads
content: The Mafatlal group, once a textile behemoth, went into survival mode at the turn of the 21st century. Now, with the fifth generation at the helm, a mindset shift and some prudence, business is up, finds Lalatendu Mishra

title: Where does India stand in tackling TB? | Explained
content: What are the hurdles in eradicating tuberculosis? Why has India missed the target of being TB-free by 2025?

title: What are the threats from GNSS spoofing? | Explained
content: Why did pilots encounter manipulated Global Navigation Satellite System signals while flying over Delhi? Which institution is heading the inquiry? How do such occurrences endanger aircraft safety? What has the aviation industry been pushing for?

title: Why was there a tech glitch at Delhi airport? | Explained
content: Why did the Automatic Message Switching System fail? What happens when there’s a technical failure? How many flights did the November 6 incident affect? What are the issues that have surfaced after the incident? Which airports use the AMSS? Does it need upgrading?

title: Justice vs judgment
content: The Bangladesh tribunal, originally created for 1971 war crimes, has evolved into a tool for political justice; reconstituted after Sheikh Hasina’s fall, it now prosecutes her government’s 2024 crackdown

title: Rajenthra Bhalaji must apologise, take back his statements about Congress: Selvaperunthagai
content: In a statement to the media, the TNCC president says the senior leadership of the AIADMK must have reprimanded Mr. Bhalaji for his comments that the Congress party should be dissolved

title: Vijay encourages TVK ‘virtual warriors’ to help family, friends, and others in SIR process
content: Alleging interference from the ruling DMK in a video released on social media, Mr. Vijay claims that those from the ruling party are not giving the forms to the members of his party

title: ‘Be truthful, patriotic, and deliver on time’, CDS Gen. Chauhan tells defence industry
content: CDS warns against exaggerated claims of indigenisation, delayed product delivery, and inflated costs, saying that such practices undermine national security

title: 'Abuses hurled, slipper raised': Lalu family feud intensifies; Rohini alleges insult over transplant
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter, Rohini Acharya, has accused her brother Tejashwi Yadav of humiliation and abuse, claiming a slipper was raised to hit her. She stated she left her parents in tears to protect her dignity. This public spat follows the RJD's significant electoral defeat and a prior family rift involving Tej Pratap Yadav.

title: With prices on boil, Trump lowers duties on tea, spices
content: US President Donald Trump has lowered import duties on nearly 200 food and agricultural items, including spices and tea, to ease rising domestic prices. This move provides a significant boost to India's key agri exports, though seafood and basmati rice remain under tariff sanctions. The exemptions aim to create a level playing field for Indian products in the US market.

title: Tear gas, chaos, and straw hats: Gen Z protests erupt in Mexico — watch
content: Thousands protested drug violence and President Sheinbaum's security policies in Mexico City, with many carrying the 'One Piece' pirate flag. The demonstration, organized by 'Generation Z,' saw clashes with police outside the National Palace. Protesters honored assassinated Mayor Carlos Manzo, though his widow distanced herself from the event.

title: 'Such actions will only fuel anger': Omar Abdullah on demolition of Dr Umar’s house
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah condemned the demolition of a Delhi "suicide bomber's" family home, questioning its effectiveness in combating terrorism.  Security forces razed the two-storey house in Pulwama, sparking criticism from PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti and NC MP Aga Ruhullah Mehdi, who labelled it "collective punishment" and an act of cruelty during harsh winter conditions.

title: Chat on WhatsApp instantly: Steps to text unsaved numbers; no new contact required
content: WhatsApp now allows users to message without saving numbers. This feature, 'Click to Chat,' lets you initiate conversations via a special link. You can even pre-fill messages. Businesses can use the official 'Chat on WhatsApp' button on their sites for easy customer contact, streamlining communication and decluttering your phone.

title: ‘Catch me if you can’ killer executed by firing squad in South Carolina
content: Stephen Bryant was executed by firing squad in South Carolina on Friday for three murders committed in 2004. This marks the first firing squad execution in the US in 15 years, as lethal injection remains the dominant method. The nation saw 43 executions this year, the highest since 2012.

title: 'Pathetic, utter nonsense': Ex-India cricketer slams Eden pitch
content: Former India spinner has strongly criticized the Eden Gardens pitch used for the India-South Africa Test, deeming it unfit for the longest format after a significant number of wickets fell within two days. He believes such conditions damage Test cricket's value and are a disservice to the game, making it impossible for even top batsmen to perform.

title: RSS-linked youth shot dead in Firozpur; family says murder was planned to create chaos
content: A relative of the deceased, Naveen, alleges his murder was a planned act to incite city-wide chaos. Naveen, whose father and grandfather were senior RSS workers, was shot by two assailants while returning home from his shop. The hospital declared him brought dead, suggesting he may have died instantly.

title: ChatGPT fixes 'big' problem; CEO calls change 'small but...'; addresses user frustrations
content: OpenAI has addressed ChatGPT's notorious overuse of em dashes, allowing users to instruct the chatbot to avoid them via custom settings. This fix, arriving with the GPT-5.1 model, ends years of user complaints and highlights the challenges in controlling AI language models, suggesting true artificial general intelligence may be further off than anticipated.

title: Shocked & scared for life: Blasts take a toll on mental health too
content: A devastating blast near Red Fort has left a deep psychological scar, impacting survivors, families, and first responders. Experts highlight the isolation of victims and the amplified trauma from graphic online visuals, especially for children. The incident triggers classic trauma responses, making everyday spaces feel threatening and demanding long-term mental health support.

title: Why did 28 blackbucks die at Belagavi zoo in 3 days?
content: Twenty-eight blackbucks have died at Belagavi's Rani Channamma Mini Zoo in three days, with preliminary investigations pointing to a bacterial infection. Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre has ordered a probe by experts and instructed zoo staff to isolate the remaining animals to prevent further spread of the disease.

title: Bihar polls similar to those seen in North Korea, Russia & China, says Digvijaya Singh
content: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh raised eyebrows by likening the Bihar election results to political scenarios in North Korea, Russia, and China, suggesting that dubious practices may have influenced the outcome.

title: Mark Zuckerberg's charity insight: Researchers demanding GPUs; reject space and staff
content: Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan's philanthropic organisation, CZI, is now prioritising computing power, specifically GPUs, over physical expansion for its science and AI mission.  Researchers at Biohub are demanding more GPUs, which Chan describes as 'new lab space' that is more expensive than traditional facilities. This strategic shift aims to accelerate breakthroughs in AI-powered biology.

title: Delhi car blast: How video grabs from 50 CCTVs helped track Umar’s movements
content: Fresh CCTV footage reveals car bomber Umar Un Nabi using two phones and visiting a tea shop before the Red Fort blast.  Investigators tracked his movements across Delhi, including visits to Mayur Vihar and Connaught Place, before he reached the Red Fort parking lot.  The blast's impact was felt even at the metro station.

title: Dillon Danis goes head-to-head with Abubakar Nurmagomedov in a wild brawl
content: Dillon Danis caused a major disturbance at UFC 322. He clashed with fighters in the stands, leading to a chaotic brawl. Security and police intervened to control the situation. The incident drew significant attention, overshadowing the championship fights. Danis was escorted out of the arena. The event highlighted the unpredictable nature of rivalries outside the octagon.

title: 'Do not get on a boat': UK rolls out toughest asylum overhaul in decades
content: Britain is set to implement a significantly tougher immigration policy, mirroring Denmark's strict asylum framework. The proposed reforms include a 20-year wait for permanent settlement for asylum seekers and a reduction in initial refugee leave. Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood stated the measures aim to deter illegal migration and unite the country amidst growing public concern.

title: ‘You’re not ready’: Michelle Obama asked if US is ready for its first female president
content: Former First Lady Michelle Obama stated the United States is not ready for a female president, citing the recent election results. She believes many men are still uncomfortable being led by women, and the country needs to mature. Obama, who campaigned for Kamala Harris, has consistently ruled out her own presidential aspirations.

title: Who is Rameez Nemat? The man behind Rohini Acharya’s exit from RJD
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter, Rohini Acharya, has accused her brother Tejashwi Yadav and aides Sanjay Yadav and Rameez Nemat of forcing her out of the family and silencing her after the RJD's election defeat. Acharya claimed she was abused and physically harmed for questioning the party's performance. This internal turmoil highlights significant cracks within the prominent political family.

title: 'Emotionally drained': RR owner explains the real reason behind Samson’s trade
content: Sanju Samson's decade-long Rajasthan Royals journey concludes in a high-profile IPL trade to Chennai Super Kings for INR 18 crore. Ravindra Jadeja and Sam Curran move to RR in a swap deal. Royals owner Manoj Badale revealed Samson's emotional exhaustion and desire for a new chapter after a challenging season, dismissing claims of team chaos.

title: Trump-era visa jitters kill big fat Indian wedding dream for Telugus in US
content: Stricter US visa rules are forcing Telugu NRIs to scale down or postpone their Indian weddings. Many are opting for intimate ceremonies in the US, prioritizing visa security over traditional grand celebrations back home. Couples on H1B and F1 visas are seeking immigration advice, with some postponing nuptials due to visa uncertainties.

title: 'Thorough exchange of views’: Putin, Netanyahu discuss Middle-East tensions
content: Russian President Putin and Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu discussed the Middle East, including Gaza, Iran's nuclear program, and Syria. Russia also presented its own UN resolution on Gaza, challenging a US proposal that includes a transitional administration and a potential international stabilization force.

title: 'Possessed by armed forces': 9mm cartridges recovered at Delhi car blast site
content: Nine-millimeter caliber cartridges, prohibited for civilian use, were recovered from the Red Fort blast site, adding a new dimension to the investigation. Police are probing the source of the ammunition and potential links to terror networks. The National Medical Commission has also cancelled the registration of four doctors from Jammu and Kashmir in connection with the case.

title: 'Missing' Punjab woman Sarabjeet Kaur, embraces Islam, marries Pakistani man
content: A 48-year-old woman, Sarabjeet Kaur, who accompanied a Sikh Jatha to Pakistan, has reportedly embraced Islam and married a Pakistani citizen, Naseer Hussain, of her own free will. She appeared before a magistrate in Sheikhupura, adopting the name Noor and stating she wished to live with her husband.  Her family in India was reportedly unaware of her decision until recently.

title: IPL 2026 retention analysis: KKR, SRH hit reset; CSK, RR gear up for full-scale overhauls in Abu Dhabi
content: KKR and SRH dominated retention day, entering the December 16 mini-auction with lean squads of 12 and 15 after bold calls. Meanwhile, CSK and RR at the centre of headline-grabbing moves involving Ravindra Jadeja, Sanju Samson and Sam Curran face major rebuilding jobs ahead of the Abu Dhabi auction.

title: 'Nothing came out of Op Sindoor': Farooq Abdullah urges improving Ind-Pak ties; quotes Vajpayee
content: Following recent blasts, JKNC chief Farooq Abdullah urged India and Pakistan to improve relations, echoing Vajpayee's sentiment. He called for an independent inquiry into the Nowgam incident, suggesting mishandling of explosives. Abdullah also highlighted the growing distrust towards Kashmiris nationwide and stressed the need for accountability and a thorough investigation into the blast's circumstances.

title: Denied BJP ticket, RSS man dies by suicide in Thiruvananthapuram
content: An RSS worker died by suicide in Thiruvananthapuram after allegedly being denied a BJP ticket for local body elections. The deceased, Anand Thampi, named several BJP and RSS leaders in his suicide note, accusing them of involvement in a 'soil mafia' and citing harassment. His death follows a pattern of suicides linked to RSS-BJP circles in recent months.

title: Rajasthan Royals likely to hand Ravindra Jadeja the captaincy for IPL 2026
content: Ravindra Jadeja returns to Rajasthan Royals after 17 years, traded from CSK for Sanju Samson. This homecoming, following his 2008 debut under Shane Warne, fills a crucial void for the Royals. Jadeja is also a strong contender for captaincy, with an announcement expected soon.

title: Are cloves good for oral health? Know its benefits, uses, and precautions
content: Cloves, a natural remedy, offer significant oral health benefits. Their compound eugenol fights harmful mouth bacteria and provides pain relief. Research supports these effects, showing reduced bacteria and temporary pain reduction. However, concentrated clove oil demands careful application to avoid irritation and toxicity. Always dilute clove oil and seek professional dental advice for persistent issues.

title: Stone quarry collapse in UP's Sonbhadra: 1 dead, 8 feared trapped
content: A stone quarry caved in Sonbhadra, Uttar Pradesh, on Saturday afternoon, resulting in one worker's death and at least eight feared trapped. Rescue operations are underway by NDRF and SDRF teams, hindered by darkness and the quarry's significant depth. Officials are investigating the incident, with quarry owners reportedly fleeing.

title: Why your morning blood sugar is high: Key risk factors and how to manage it
content: High fasting blood sugar in the morning can be due to the dawn phenomenon, a natural hormone surge, or the less common Somogyi effect, a rebound from low overnight glucose. Experts like Dr. Joseph Tejero emphasize that stress, poor sleep, late meals, and medication timing also contribute, requiring a holistic management approach.

title: UFC 322: Carlos Prates’ brutal KO deepens Leon Edwards’ three-fight slump
content: Carlos Prates delivered a career-defining knockout at UFC 322, stunning former champion Leon Edwards with a powerful straight left. This decisive victory marks Edwards' third consecutive loss and Prates' emergence as a major threat in the welterweight division. Prates' explosive performance, fueled by his promise of violence, has positioned him as a top contender, while Edwards faces an uncertain future.

title: Sanju Samson’s inclusion could be catalyst for MS Dhoni’s last dance for CSK
content: Sanju Samson's arrival at CSK bolsters their top-order batting, potentially signaling MS Dhoni's final season. With Ruturaj Gaikwad captaining, Samson joins the leadership group and may even don the gloves, allowing Dhoni to feature as an impact sub. This setup could facilitate Dhoni's farewell at Chepauk, fulfilling a promise to fans.

title: Dr Umar’s escape: How Delhi ‘bomber’ fled Al-Falah University after Dr Muzammil’s arrest
content: Doctor Umar Un Nabi, central to a Delhi terror plot, hid for 10 days in Nuh before the Red Fort metro station bombing. Investigators are tracking a hawala network used by the radicalized doctors' module. Raids were conducted across Nuh and Faridabad, including searches at Al-Falah University.

title: Watch: Drunk watchman caught sleeping with leg in rice vessel at Telangana hostel
content: A hostel watchman in Sangareddy district was removed from duty after being found inebriated and sleeping with his leg in a pot of cooked rice. The incident, captured in a viral video by students, led to immediate action by district authorities. Officials have been directed to ensure strict hostel supervision and hygienic food for students.

title: Controversial! 'Kohli, Dayal in same poster, what a shame': RCB slammed
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru faces backlash for retaining fast-bowler Yash Dayal for IPL 2026. Dayal faces serious criminal allegations in Ghaziabad and Jaipur. These include sexual and financial exploitation, and rape charges. He is banned from Uttar Pradesh's local league. RCB's decision to keep him on a Rs 5 crore contract has angered fans.

title: Bengaluru techie files complaint after shoes worth Rs 16,000 go missing at temple
content: A software engineer's Rs 16,000 branded shoes were stolen from outside a Bengaluru temple. Despite initial police reluctance, an FIR was filed after the techie highlighted the recurring issue. CCTV footage captured the thief, and police are now working to apprehend them.

title: 5 meditation habits that build emotional strength in just 2 weeks
content: Feeling overwhelmed? Psychic counsellor suggests five simple daily meditation habits. These brief practices help calm your mind and return you to yourself faster. They are designed to be easy to incorporate into your routine. Try them for two weeks and notice the difference in your emotional strength. This is about building resilience.

title: Made to do 100 sit-ups with bag for being late, girl dies
content: A 13-year-old girl tragically died after being subjected to 100 sit-ups with her schoolbag on her back for being ten minutes late. The Vasai student developed severe back pain following the punishment and her health rapidly declined. While police have registered an accidental death report, the family holds the school and teacher accountable. Investigations are ongoing pending the post-mortem report.

title: Karnataka shocker: Man held while transporting wife’s body with 2 others
content: Police in Kodagu have launched an investigation after three men were apprehended transporting a woman's body. The deceased, identified as Nanki Devi from Haryana, was found in a car during a routine check. Her husband and two others were detained. They claimed to be taking her to a hospital. Police suspect they intended to dispose of the body.

title: IND vs SA: Gill ruled out of Eden Gardens Test; BCCI shares latest update
content: Indian cricket captain Shubman Gill has been ruled out of the ongoing Test match against South Africa due to a neck injury sustained on Day 2. The incident occurred during a shot, leading to immediate discomfort and subsequent hospital examination. Gill will remain under observation by the BCCI medical team.

title: Election results: Bihar's political map has been redrawn — and BJP now sits at its centre
content: Bihar's political landscape has dramatically shifted as the BJP, once an outsider, has emerged as the dominant force, securing its highest-ever assembly seats.  This rise, built over decades through patient groundwork and social engineering, has redefined the state's power dynamics, potentially eclipsing Nitish Kumar's long-held influence and signaling a new era of BJP-led governance.

title: ‘Even if I scored 200’: Suryavanshi reveals father's tough love
content: Teenage sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi's grounded approach is highlighted in a recent BCCI video, showcasing a post-match chat with his father. Despite a record-breaking performance, his father still offered technical advice, emphasizing a balanced perspective on his game. Suryavanshi's humility and focus on team contribution shine through, even amidst immense public expectations.

title: Poll picture becomes clearer in Kozhikode
content: LDF announces candidates for 73 divisions in Corpn; UDF announces majority of candidates; BJP to complete candidate list for Corpn. as well as district panchayat on Sunday

title: Tamil Nadu moves Supreme Court against President’s refusal to grant assent to anti-NEET Bill
content: Tamil Nadu urged the Supreme Court to pronounce the President’s refusal as unconstitutional and declared that the 2021 Bill is deemed to have received assent

title: Saalumarada Thimmakka laid to rest with state honours
content: As a mark of tribute, 114 saplings will be planted and nurtured at 114 locations across Karnataka, symbolising each year of Thimmakka’s life

title: Why did ECI allow distribution of scheme funds during Bihar polls, asks Sharad Pawar
content: If ruling parties use a similar method in elections, it will hamper the trust of the people as well as the election process, he said

title: Assam to ink deal with British Museum to bring back Vrindavani Vastra
content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma left for London on Saturday to initiate the process for the revered silk textile linked to 15th-16th century saint-reformer Srimanta Sankaradeva

title: Amit Shah holds closed-door meeting in Delhi to discuss government formation in Bihar
content: BJP, JD(U) along with other alliance partners have asked their MLAs to come to Patna; leader says all formalities, including decision on Chief Minister, will be over in two to three days

title: Industry summit drew over ₹13 lakh crore investment pledges: Andhra CM
content: The energy sector led the way with investment pledges of over ₹5.3 lakh crore, followed by industries, and infrastructure

title: Naidu’s ambitious flying cars/drone taxis goal gets positive response
content: MD Maini Group claims that the firm already has all the necessary component manufacturing needed for flying cars, adding that “We are just waiting for the suitable policy from the State and Central governments”

title: Tamil Nadu to get intense rainfall as new low pressure area forms off Sri Lankan coast
content: While heavy rainfall is expected to initially cover the delta districts, the intense rain will spread to the coastal belt and adjoining districts from Monday

title: T.N. government applies for Hosur airport site clearance
content: Sources say obtaining the Centre’s nod will take at least six to eight months. It has once again written to the Defence Ministry asking permission to relax airspace restrictions for the airport

title: Gloom, shock grip Valley as Nowgam blast victims’ bodies reach hometowns
content: Houses adjacent to the police station suffer damages and cracks; families and locals conduct last rites of victims of the blast, J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah announces compensation

title: With 1,700 aircraft pending orders, India needs 30,000 pilots: Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu
content: In order to meet the demand there should be more Flying Training Organisations (FTO) as the existing ones produce only a limited number, says Union Civil Aviation Minister K. Ram Mohan Naidu

title: Bengaluru: Flash protest in Lalbagh against proposed twin tunnel project linking Hebbal and Silk Board
content: The All India Students Association (AISA) and Fridays For Future–Karnataka, which led the protest, alleged that the government is pushing ahead with the multi-crore project despite expert warnings and unresolved gaps in the Detailed Project Report (DPR)

title: Self reliance, skills and collaboration in defence stressed
content: A technology-oriented sector such as defence requires investment from the government as well as others, including startups, says CMD of Bharat Electronics

title: Bengaluru corporations race against time to tick SC directives on stray dog management
content: However, several shortcomings remain, especially regarding the ‘area designation’ required for sheltering dogs, which could potentially have a negative impact

title: Lokesh announces Naipunyam skill portal, unveils A.P.’s Quantum Policy at CII Summit
content: The new portal will use AI to guide youth through personalised skill upgrades, while the first-of-its-kind Quantum Policy establishes India’s largest open testbed and strengthens research, talent and hardware capabilities in Amaravati

title: Raja Ram Mohan Roy was a ‘British agent’ aiding religious conversions, claims M.P. Minister
content: At an event to mark anniversary of tribal leader Birsa Munda, Higher Education Minister Inder Singh Parmar says the tribal icon had tried to stop the ‘cycle of religious conversion run by some fake social reformers’ at the behest of the British rulers

title: Officials told to increase number of free buses in Tirumala
content: TTD Executive Officer directs officials to speed up the construction process of TTD temples in several States during a review meeting

title: ECI plans for pre-mapped data during SIR Phase 2 remain unclear
content: While poll panel hopes to use pre-mapping exercise to match names in old SIR lists with the current electoral roll, officers across several States pass on the buck to the electors

title: ED arrests OSBPL MD on money laundering charges, sent to 14-day custody
content: The probe agency conducted searches at nine locations in and around Delhi and other places, following which it arrested Swaraj Singh Yadav, the MD of Ocean Seven Buildtech Private Limited (OSBPL)

title: Health Minister inaugurates 10 new AMRIT outlets across India
content: AMRIT pharmacies have been providing life-saving and essential medicines at discounts ranging from 50% to 90%

title: Revanth gets pat from Rahul Gandhi and Kharge for victory in Jubilee Hills
content: Rahul Gandhi tells State Congress leaders to strengthen the party further, and says the party has a huge responsibility on its shoulders for taking all sections of the society along with it

title: Equal representation drive demands action, not excuses, from Kerala’s political leadership
content: State convention of Thulya Pradinithya Prasthanam organised at the Kerala Sahitya Akademi Hall in Thrissur

title: Post-mortem points out multiple bites by dogs responsible for senior citizen’s death at Kumpala
content: The post-mortem of Dayananda Gatti, 60, who was found dead at Kumpala on the outskirts of Mangaluru, has reportedly revealed that he was bitten by multiple dogs, apart from the dog that was caught by the civic personnel

title: RSS worker found hanging
content: WhatsApp message purportedly written by Anand K. Thampi before his death mentions denial of ticket as a reason for “ending life”

title: Bride-To-Be Killed By Fiance Hour Before Wedding After Fight Over Saree
content: A woman was allegedly killed by her fiance inside their house in Gujarat's Bhavnagar city, an hour before the couple was to get married on Saturday, police said.

title: Lalu Yadav's Daughter's "Dirty Kidney" Bombshell Amid Widening Family Feud
content: The feud within RJD patriarch Lalu Yadav's family appears to grow wider after the election setback, with his daughter Rohini Acharya making fresh allegations against her relatives.

title: Trinamool MP's Bengal Governor "Giving Weapons To BJP" Remark Sparks Row
content: Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Kalyan Banerjee has stoked controversy after claiming that West Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose was providing arms and ammunition to Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders inside his house, the Raj Bhavan.

title: Tejashwi Yadav Blamed Sister Rohini Acharya For Bihar Rout, Threw Slipper At Her: Sources
content: Tejashwi Yadav, whose RJD won just 25 seats in the 2025 Bihar assembly elections, its second-worst performance in a poll after 2010, had a heated argument with his sister, Rohini Acharya, after the defeat.

title: 5 Dead As Speeding SUV Rams Into Sand-Filled Tractor In Madhya Pradesh
content: Five young men, all friends, were killed in a road accident on the Gwalior-Jhansi Highway in Madhya Pradesh on Sunday, officials said.

title: 1 Dead, Many Feared Trapped After Stone Quarry Collapse In UP's Sonbhadra
content: The body of a labourer was pulled out on Sunday morning from the rubble of a stone quarry that collapsed in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra, while several others remain trapped, a senior police official said.

title: After RSS Activist, BJP Worker Attempts Suicide Over Ticket Denial
content: A Mahila Morcha (Women's wing of BJP) activist attempted to commit suicide, allegedly fearing that she would not be given a ticket in the local body election at Nedumangad on Sunday, police said.

title: "You Have Opened My Eyes": Amitabh Bachchan To KBC Contestant On Veganism
content: Bollywood megastar Amitabh Bachchan feels "troubled" after learning the ethical realities behind veganism during an episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati (KBC) Season 17.

title: Fake Microsoft Support Racket Targeting US Citizens Busted In Bengaluru, 21 Arrested
content: The Bengaluru Police on Saturday busted a large-scale cyber-fraud operation in the city that was cheating US citizens by posing as Microsoft Technical Support.

title: Ex-IPS Officer, Who Switched To BJP From Prashant Kishor Camp, Wins Bihar Polls
content: Anand Mishra, a 2011-batch IPS officer, defeated Congress candidate Sanjay Kumar Tiwari by a margin of over 28,000 votes in Buxar.

title: Trump Says He Will Sue BBC For $5 Billion. Why He Faces High Hurdles
content: Donald Trump said he would sue the BBC over an edit of his January 6, 2021, speech that made it seem he was directly calling for violence at the US Capitol.

title: Bihar Cabinet Formula Finalised, Nitish Kumar To Remain Chief Minister: Sources
content: Nitish Kumar will remain the Chief Minister of Bihar, sources have indicated, with the formation of the new state government expected in another three days after the cabinet formula was finalised at a meeting with Union Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: "Ganga, Yamuna Wasn't Enough": Indian Seen Washing Feet In Thames Sparks Row
content: A video of an Indian man washing his feet in London's River Thames has gone viral. The clip shows the man rinsing his feet as he stands at the river's edge. He then allegedly goes on to take a bath in the river, some reports claim.

title: Bihar's New Government Formation Likely On November 19-20: Sources
content: Bihar's new government is likely to be formed on November 19-20, with the process gaining momentum following the issuance of the notification to constitute the 18th Bihar Assembly.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Bihar Must Be A Lesson To Opposition: Value The Woman Voter
content: Here is a constituency that cuts across caste, religion and social economic dynamics, and we would be doing our election strategy a huge disservice by not engaging with it meaningfully.

title: Bihar Results: Tej Pratap Yadav's Party Draws A Blank, He Ends Up Third In Mahua
content: Former Bihar chief minister Lalu Prasad Yadav's elder son Tej Pratap Yadav, who was expelled from the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD), floated his own political front to contest in the assembly elections in Bihar.

title: Man, Who Beheaded Lover In Noida, Said She Used To 'Extort Money' From Him
content: A 34-year-old man arrested for murdering his extramarital lover and dumping her body parts across Noida and Ghaziabad, said that the woman had been extorting money from him. The accused, Monu Singh murdered his lover, Preeti Yadav, inside a bus.

title: Lured With High Returns, Bengaluru Man Loses Rs 92.57 Lakh In Forex Fraud
content: A Bengaluru man was allegedly cheated of Rs 92.57 lakh through an online forex trading scheme run under the names ICON Forex and Forex Wealth, after he was lured with promises of high returns

title: Lal Quila Metro Station Fully Reopens Days After Deadly Car Blast
content: All the gates of the Lal Quila (Red Fort) Metro Station have been reopened for commuters, the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) announced on Sunday, marking the first full resumption of access since the November 10 car blast near the station.

title: i20 Behind Blast Near Red Fort Was Seen At Al Falah Varsity Last Month: CCTV
content: The white Hyundai i20 car that exploded near the Red Fort earlier this week was parked at Al Falah University in Faridabad last month, CCTV footage accessed by investigating agencies showed.

title: Will your team make the playoffs? Simulate the rest of the regular season
content: Loading Playoff Seeds 1st Seed New England Proj:   9-2 7th Seed Jacksonville Proj:   5-4 2nd Seed Indianapolis Proj:   8-2 6th Seed Buffalo Proj:   6-3 3rd Seed Denver Proj:   8-2 5th Seed Los Angeles Proj:   7-3 4th Seed Pittsburgh Proj:   5-4 1st Seed Philadelphia Proj:   7-2 7th Seed Green Bay Proj:   5-3-1 2nd Seed Seattle Proj:   7-2 6th Seed Chicago Proj:   6-3 3rd Seed Detroit Proj:   6-3 5th Seed Los Angeles Proj:   7-2 4th Seed Tampa Bay Proj:   6-3 See what the latest playoff picture looks like and simulate your own playoff scenarios! title: NBA execs, scouts on Mavs' spiral and five more early-season trends
content: there weren't many people believing GM Nico Harrison should have remained as Mavs general manager . we decided to ask league executives and scouts if they're believing in some of the most impactful early-season trends across the NBA . the crater that is the Mavericks franchise before moving on to hot starts for the lakers .

title: Loophole allows McIntyre to return, join Team Vision
content: "you gotta read the fine print" in pro wrestling contracts . the agreement states he could choose any member of the WWE roster across all brands . a suspended Drew McIntyre showed up at the end of "SmackDown" to align himself with Heyman and The Vision .

title: Intel: Could Elee flip? Texas A&M and Miami making moves
content: atop the 2026 class, multiple programs are stepping up their efforts to flip five-star Maryland defensive end commit Zion Elee . Miami , Ohio State , Ole Miss and Texas A&M are each set to host coveted flip targets in week 12 . the market, led by Penn State decommit Davion Brown, is bubbling .

title: Area 51, an alien and the most fearsome young duo in the NBA
content: stepon CASTLE screamed, streaking down the floor with 8:28 left in the second quarter of the San Antonio Spurs . "RIM, VIC!" was a turning point in tv's season-opening win in Dallas . a whistle quickly pierced the noisy celebration as Dallas called a timeout to regroup .

title: Mbappé too focused on another French World Cup triumph to dwell on 400 goals
content: francais beat Ukraine 4-0 in the 2026 world cup on friday night . three players were missing from the 26-man squad . manu Koné is suspended for the game and went back to his club, AS Roma . he scored two goals and one assist for his side .

title: Pajor double ensures Barça revenge in Clásico romp over Madrid
content: ewa Pajor scored twice on her first start in more than a month as real madrid beat real 4-0 . the result extends their lead at the top of the league to seven points . pajor had the ball in the net four times inside 30 minutes .

title: 14 more Week 11 games, 14 matchup previews: Predictions and picks
content: quarterbacks and quarterbacks play each other in an NFC West showdown . fantasy analyst Eric Moody shares fantasy football intel . givv is a betting nugget for each matchup . we have the football power index (FPI) game projections .

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 11
content: this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities and, of course, easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS . we have folded the Shadow Reports, previously a separate column, into the game-by-game breakdowns here .

title: UFC 322 takeaways: Makhachev dominates, Prates shows off at MSG
content: Islam Makhachev becomes the new welterweight champion after putting on a wrestling clinic . a few weeks ago he felt he was about 60% to 70% of himself at lightweight because of the drastic weight cut . the undisputed flyweight queen beats Zhang Weili (1:08)

title: Projecting Tuesday's CFP top 12: Where do the Sooners and Tide land?
content: the college football playoff selection committee's third ranking is guaranteed to look different Tuesday night . the biggest question is how the two-loss teams will stack up . assuming the committee rewards Oklahoma's head-to-head win against the Tide, the duo will likely be a package deal .

title: 'Thank you for staying with us': Mike Elko leads best quips of Week 12 in college football
content: Texas A&M trailed 30-3 in the first half to complete the largest comeback in school history . this week, another batch of coaches brought their team's momentum off the field to their postgame media availability . the gamecocks raced out to a 30-3 lead before the break, before the Aggies stormed back .

title: 😈 Arizona, Texas A&M top Week 12 CFB trolls
content: the wildcats went down 14-7 in the first quarter, but scored 20 points in the second half, pulling ahead for good on a 50-yard touchdown run by Kedrick Reescano . south Carolina was up 30-3 over no. 3 Texas A&M at halftime .

title: The SEC offered a dose of playoff football in Week 12
content: the 2025 season has been more bluster than reality . the balance of power seems to sway like an LSU fan after a 12-hour tailgate . it's the perfect showcase for this heart-pounding reality, with a team's fortunes waning .

title: Bihar poll: In 35 seats, PK's party tally more than win margin — but critics call him a spoiler
content: the party lost its deposit in 236 of the 238 seats that it contested . in 35 constituencies, the party's votes were higher than the winning margin . data suggests it may have played spoiler in quite a few seats .

title: 'Nationwide laundering scam': Judge holds 3 am court to remand accused
content: ED's move came in connection with the alleged laundering of more than Rs 222 crore of funds generated from illegal sale of apartments meant for the poor under PM Awas Yojana . these were sold at an inflated price of Rs 40-50 lakh each to new buyers by cheating the original allottees whose allotment was cancelled .

title: Kids with sight, hearing disabilities decode bird calls in U’khand avian census
content: students in dehradun took part in the second cycle of the Uttarakhand Bird Count 2025 . statewide, 144 observers, including specially-abled participants, recorded 344 species . eight visually impaired boys used sound, while nine hearing-impaired students relied on sight .
